credit.name: R. Guigó Lab: Computational Biology of RNA processing @ CRG, Barcelona.

description:
Nextflow pipeline for splicing quantitative trait loci (sQTL) mapping based on sQTLseekeR2.
The pipeline performs the following analysis steps: 1) Index the genotype file, 2) Preprocess the transcript expression data, 3) Test for association between splicing ratios (a multivariate phenotype) and genetic variants in cis (nominal pass), 4) Obtain an empirical P-value for each phenotype (permutation pass, optional), 5) Control for multiple testing.

function.note:
sQTLseekeR2 is an enhanced version of sQTLseekeR, an R package to detect splicing QTLs (sQTLs). sQTLs are genetic variants associated with changes in the splicing patterns. In sQTLseekeR, splicing patterns are defined by the relative expression of the transcripts of a gene (a multivariate phenotype).

For more information about the method and performance see: Garrido-Martín, D. et al. Identification and analysis of splicing quantitative trait loci across multiple tissues in the human genome. BiorXiv. doi: 10.1101/2020.05.29.123703  (2020) and Monlong, J. et al. Identification of genetic variants associated with alternative splicing using sQTLseekeR. Nat. Commun. 5:4698 doi: 10.1038/ncomms5698 (2014).

name: sqtlseeker2-nf
